attributes.action: Rolling 3 Monthly Vote of No Confidence Evaluation Policy in any Prime Minister
attributes.additional_details:
Employing such a regular evaluation policy will help to uphold democracy and hold any prime minister accountable for their actions and decisions.

If they retain the confidence of the majority of their party's MPs they carry on as Prime Minister until the next evaluation period.

If a Prime Minister loses a vote of confidence by at least 51% they must immediately step down and a new leader must be chosen by a vote amongst all Party members.
attributes.background: Every 3 months a Prime Minister undergoes a Vote of Confidence Evaluation. All MPs in their party get to vote. If 51% of that parties MPs vote against the Prime Minister - they will be required by law to step down and a new leadership challenge immediately instigated.

rejection.details: We can't accept your petition because it would be for political parties to establish such a system, not the UK Government or Parliament as a whole.
